image.altText: Adelaide Oval with the River Torrens and the pedestrian bridge with green signage on it

props.synopsis: Adelaide's River Torrens has battled pollution and an image problem over the decades — but there is now a proposal to bring back swimming to the waterway.

title.children: The River Torrens has battled pollution — can it be safe for swimming?

image.altText: A man walks from court with a straight face

props.synopsis: A South Australian Uber driver has been found guilty of indecently assaulting a female passenger almost two years ago.

title.children: Adelaide Uber driver found guilty of indecently assaulting passenger

image.altText: A police officer looking in the back of a white van

props.synopsis: Police believe a man murdered his partner and then took his own life in South Australia's south-east.

title.children: SA Police say man killed partner, then himself in Bordertown

image.altText: A worker operating the furnace at the Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: Some of the world's biggest steel companies have formed a consortium that could acquire the Whyalla steelworks from administration. The news comes as residents in nearby Port Pirie anxiously await an announcement about the future of their city's lead smelter.

title.children: Global steelmakers line up for potential Whyalla steelworks takeover

image.altText: A woman walks from court surrounded by a group of cameramen.

props.synopsis: A South Australian woman who drank an entire cask of wine before driving through a stop sign and into a police car has been handed a suspended sentence.

title.children: Driver who consumed cask of wine before crashing into police car handed suspended sentence

image.altText: John Brewster, Rick Brewster and Jane Lomax-Smith

props.synopsis: A week after placing at number 12 in the Hottest 100 of Australian Songs, rock legends The Angels have been honoured with a mural and laneway in Adelaide's CBD.

title.children: Adelaide laneway named in honour of rock band The Angels

image.altText: A green and yellow ambulance driving on a road

props.synopsis: A high profile inquest into the ramping deaths of three South Australians featured a witness who described media coverage of the phenomenon as "hysterical". Reporter Stephanie Richards explores the obligations and challenges of reporting on public health.

title.children: Are South Australian journalists ‘hysterical’ about ambulance ramping?

props.synopsis: Adelaide's Glenelg tramline will be out of action for up to six months to allow for major upgrade works, including construction of three new overpasses. Here's a look at how that will impact public transport users, drivers and businesses.

title.children: Glenelg trams are out of action amid Adelaide overpass work. Here's what to expect

image.altText: A young man smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Riley Turnbull was a healthy teenager, but when his kidneys started failing, his world changed.

title.children: Healthy, sport-obsessed teen's world changed by kidney failure

image.altText: A fisher along the South Australian coast.

props.synopsis: Support for South Australia's recreational fishing sector amid the ongoing algal bloom crisis will include the creation of an artificial reef in Gulf St Vincent and the expansion of fishing in reservoirs "where consistent with public health advice", the state government says.

title.children: Artificial reef and reservoir fishing to tackle algal bloom's impact on tourism

image.altText: A man looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Eighty years after World War II, some of Japan's last survivors are still pushing for an apology and recognition. But time is running out.

title.children: The one thing Japan's last World War II survivors are still waiting for

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Facing domestic pressure and international condemnation, Benjamin Netanyahu will convene a meeting of his security cabinet to consider the Israeli military's next moves.

title.children: Netanyahu to consider 'next steps' in Gaza war as aid deliveries continue

image.altText: A number of cans of energy drinks.

props.synopsis: As cases of blood toxicity from Vitamin B6 continue to rise doctors raise concerns about the level of the product in food and especially energy drinks.

title.children: 'It's Vitamin B6': Damage being caused by toxicity spreads to more products

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera seated in a garden

props.synopsis: For most people, a package delivered to their homes is usually welcomed but for people experiencing domestic violence, alcohol delivery is "like the guided missile that is the match".

title.children: Former Neighbours star urges changes to alcohol delivery laws

image.altText: The Adelaide CBD viewed from the air looking down on West Terrace

props.synopsis: The Lord Mayor wants to nearly double the population of the CBD and North Adelaide by 2036. The last time the city had close to 50,000 residents, it was lectured for having "slums".

title.children: Adelaide's plan to double its CBD population without 'destroying the city'

image.altText: Picture of stock market board with ASX sign at the top left corner.

props.synopsis: Stock markets are overcooked and operating dangerously close to the Sun, writes Ian Verrender.

title.children: Why stock markets continue to defy gravity

image.altText: NSW police car parked in a residential street at night time

props.synopsis: Police say the two girls were known to each other, and homicide detectives are assisting with the investigation.

title.children: Teenage girl dead, another arrested after stabbing in Newcastle

image.altText: Two selfies of an older man with white hair, stubble and bulging fake eye.

props.synopsis: The work of artificial eye maker Jack McDonald is again in question after more people come forward complaining about the eyes he has made for them.

title.children: 'I looked like a corpse': More complaints against prosthetic eye maker

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Jim Chalmers in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: Inside Labor, two camps have formed around the government's productivity roundtable: those who doubt Anthony Albanese has the inclination to tackle contentious new policy and those who see a genuine opportunity to achieve something of substance.

title.children: Will Labor's conversation about everything produce anything much?

image.altText: A man with a long beard poses for a photo while seated outside, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: More than two years after Chris Minns pledged to "declare war" on toll road administration fees, his government has yet to fulfil its promise to reduce the fees that toll road operators levy on drivers who fail to pay to use their roads.

title.children: NSW government yet to deliver on toll fee reduction promise

image.altText: Seneca Martin close-up at Garma.

props.synopsis: Like their Yolŋu hosts on Gumatj country, the stories, dance and regalia of Navajo, Comanche, Kiowa Sioux, Pueblo and Lakota nations in North America are intertwined with the land and natural environment.

title.children: Flying from across the ocean, feathered regalia lands on an ancient ground

image.altText: Tesla Powerwalls installed at a home.

props.synopsis: After surrendering its dominance of Australian electric vehicle sales, Tesla is also now also rapidly losing ground in the home battery market.

title.children: Home battery sales are booming, but Tesla is fast losing market share

image.altText: A young Sudanese man with short curly hair.

props.synopsis: A 26-year-old man who has been missing in the outback for a week has been found alive near Jay Creek outstation by residents of the Aboriginal homeland, close to where police discovered items of his clothing.

title.children: Missing man found alive a week after disappearance

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands looking neutrally at each other with a man and woman sitting behind them

props.synopsis: The threat is the latest example of deteriorating relations between the US and India, with a trade deal still not struck despite months of negotiations.

title.children: Trump threatens India with further tariff hikes over Russian oil

image.altText: SHEIN

props.synopsis: Behind the TikTok hauls to Insta-ready aesthetic, a backlash is brewing, and Italy and France are leading the way.

title.children: Shein hype dominates social media, but in Europe the firm's accused of greenwashing

image.altText: graphic of a young girl's silhouette with the scales of justice

props.synopsis: According to Australian law, children are empowered to make their own decisions about the healthcare they receive — regardless of parental consent — so long as they fully understand what is being done.

title.children: Why the courts stepped in when a 12-year-old wanted an abortion

image.altText: Donald Trump speaking to the media while standing on an airport runway in Pennsylvania.

props.synopsis: Comments by former Russian president Dmitry Medvedev led Donald Trump to announce he had repositioned two of the US's nuclear submarines.

title.children: Russia downplays Trump's nuclear submarine move, urges caution

image.altText: A settler teenager looks at a mobile phone while herding a flock of sheep.

props.synopsis: In the Jordan Valley in the Israeli-occupied West Bank, teenage shepherds escorted by armed security guards are trying to push Palestinian villagers from their farms.

title.children: 'Now, there's nothing stopping them': Settlers trying new forms of intimidation

image.altText: Elon Musk wearing a black Make America Great Again cap and sunglasses.

props.synopsis: The massive payout comes just six months after a judge ordered the company to revoke another mega pay package worth $86 billion.

title.children: Tesla awards its CEO Elon Musk $44bn in shares

image.altText: A close up of Sussan Ley.

props.synopsis: Asked multiple times last week whether she believed there was starvation within Gaza, the opposition leader would not answer directly, instead saying it was a "complex situation".

title.children: Ley admits there is starvation in Gaza after previously avoiding the question

image.altText: A police officer and a distressed looking woman sit opposite one another at a dining table in a house.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson is seen handing over a "dummy" phone during a police search of her home, in new vision released by the Supreme Court.

title.children: 'I'll seize that now': Court releases footage of police confiscating Erin Patterson's phone

image.altText: Stephen Nutt stands in his police uniform, speaking in front of a sign that says AFP.

props.synopsis: A Chinese national has faced a Canberra court today after being arrested on Saturday and charged with foreign interference.

title.children: Chinese national charged under foreign interference laws

image.altText: A middle aged man in a black rain jacket, staring somberly on the Sydney Harbour Bridge, with protesters in the background.

props.synopsis: The march on Sydney Harbour Bridge over the weekend has further fuelled political debate over Australia's position and response to ongoing humanitarian situation in war-ravaged Gaza.

title.children: Divided reaction to Sydney protest, Gazan grateful for 'solidarity'

image.altText: A hairy brown miniature highland cow with horns.

props.synopsis: The good news is miniature Highland cows exist. The bad news is they are a lucrative trade for scammers.

title.children: Victims lose thousands of dollars in 'sophisticated' mini cow scam
